nodes.bodyText: Its better to create a props object that can then be used in render. We will then have a common set of props required for the component and can add overrides based on the needs of the test. We can avoid making changes in every test like adding primaryKey in this PR and the tests will be maintainable.
Agree it's better to use props objects and override them when needed. Thanks.
All these tests for popover and tooltips, we should group them together instead of adding 1 line tests.
Merged tests.

there is already a test for column selector visibility and the test to verify tooltip should go in there. All tests should be grouped together when possible. We should try to avoid one line tests. A typical user would not login to HC and navigate to explorer tile to verify tooltip or popover closes.
Lets remember the Guiding Principle of RTL whenever tests are added -- "The more your tests resemble the way your software is used, the more confidence they can give you."
Merged tests.
@timur-isangulov Removing hasOwnProperty condition will throw an error when user clicks on last processed time from modelling screen
A very solid reason to add RTL tests for Browse page.
Hi Sanjeevani, thank you for testing and noticing this case. I changed the logic can you please review again.
Must verify the warning message. This can be verified via RTL as well, just FYI.
can we try using cy.findByTestId.
Not sure if the cypress has this function, the RTL does have.

I am surprised you arent aware. We have imported RTL extension for cypress that lets us use data-testid and some other methods that we are familiar with in RTL, since couple of months.
Just type cy.find and you will see.
ok. replaced to findByTestId.
Need a test to verify this tooltip.
Added test.
i believe this is the fix for browser back button issue. Need a test for this.
There are tests for that created before by Sanjeevni.

That test doesnt verify the issue for HTTP 400 console error. The test passes I believe which indicates that it doesnt verify the issue in question. Other than console error we also get this:

If this bug fixes these issues then we need a test for the same. Hope you have reproduced the issue and have steps to add a test for the same.
Not sure what this is for. can you pls explain.
Removed.
Comments are good to have and I was asking for the intent of the code after this comment.
I was asking for what this code block is for, so I can comment on what type of tests we should add.
This just looking for array datatype in the properties. I don't think comments are needed for the simple functions.
